The Elder Bākula’s Birth Story
“Not far from the Himalayas,
there is a mountain named Sobhita;
My hermitage was well-prepared,
made by my own disciples.
There were many pavilions there,
with blooming jasmine flowers;
There were many wood-apple trees there,
with blooming jīvajīvaka flowers.
There were many nigguṇḍi trees there,
with jujube and emblic myrobalan;
Phārusaka and bottle-gourd,
and blooming white water-lilies.
There were āḷakā and beluva trees there,
plantain and margosa trees;
There were many mahānāma trees there,
ajjuna and piyaṅgu trees.
Kosambī, saḷalā, nimbā,
nigrodha, and wood-apple trees;
Such was my hermitage,
and I, a disciple, lived there.
The Blessed One Anomadassī,🔽the Self-Existent, Leader of the World;
Searching for seclusion,
he came to my hermitage.
When I approached the Great Hero,
the greatly illustrious Anomadassī,
in an instant, the Protector of the World
contracted a wind illness.🔽Wandering in the forest,
I saw the Leader of the World;
Having approached the Sambuddha,🔽the Visionary, the One of Great Renown,
And having seen his conduct,
I understood at that time;
For the Buddha, without doubt,
had no illness arise.
Quickly I went to the hermitage,
in the presence of my disciples;
Desiring to make medicine,
I addressed my disciples then.
Having listened to my words,
all the disciples with respect,
Gathered together in one place,
out of respect for the Teacher.
Quickly climbing the mountain,
with all the great herbs,
Having prepared the medicinal drink,
I always attended to the Buddha, the Best.
When the Great Hero,
the Omniscient Leader of the World, had eaten,
The wind quickly subsided,
of the Sugata, the Great Sage.
Seeing the illness pacified,
Anomadassī, of great renown,
Sitting in his seat,
recited these verses:
‘He who gave me medicine,
and cured my illness,
I will praise him,
listen to me as I speak.
For a hundred thousand eons,
will delight in the deva world;
There, with the sound of musical instruments,
he will always rejoice.
Having returned to the human world,
